Name: Vase in steatite
Description: This beautiful vase in steatite, of which the provenance is not known, was purchased during the public sale of the Amherst collection at London in 1921. With a quite classical form, the object is characterised by a nearly round belly, surmounted by a large flared neck, which is provided with a rounded edge, and supported by a small, simple, round socle. It dates from the New Kingdom.
